column4: <trism> soreau: and you can copy anything to ~/.config/autostart and it will override the .desktop file in /etc/xdg/autostart <-- this doesn't make two bits of sense to me. What would make sense is having xscreensaver installed would automagically replace gnome-screensaver for startup and configuration
Instead I not only get two entries for 'Screensaver' in the menu, but I don't see a way to change it via GUI
Canonical really needs to get their act together instead of piling on more crap no one wants or needs
umm zanus cares. i kind of care too
